channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Constant dumped household goods, 6th December
item.description:
Constant dumped household goods outside this white block of flats Why is the owner not sent a letter fr council about their tenants dumping all there crap on public area. It’s a public health risk - rate & foxes seen on rubbish??? Please clear again

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Nunhead Green, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Foxes causing destruction, 6th December
item.description:
In the last 2 weeks foxes have eaten the cables under our car twice, costing over £1000 to put right. We have foxes poo on our bins everyday and all over our garden. Last year the foxes ate through our internet cables and there are at least 10-15 foxes on the green at the front of our house each night going through the bins. There is a huge foxes den on the green in front of our house which the council have already tried to fill with manure although this has clearly failed by the picture I have attached.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Tillingbourne Green, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littering problem under bridge, 6th December
item.description:
Littering has gone worse under the bridge, the rubbish bins are often overflowing, there is rubbish dumped throughout the street. Would advise a more permanent solution, such as relocating the rubbish bins
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 204, Union Street, Southwark, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned council bin, ownet, 6th December
item.description:
There is an abandoned household waste bin here. It has been in the location for weeks, no-one claiming it. Issue is that it is being positioned by people’s walls at rear of Belvedere Mews to be used as access over wall and is a clear security risk. Please remove.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Langton Way, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Work on road has had repercussions and it has been left in an unacceptable condition, 6th December
item.description:
Flooding at entry to property no. 79 - caused by Thames Water blocking drain 2-3 weeks ago with debris that had run off - someone eventually unblocked it (possibly) but it has left sludge in gutter which recent rains have done nothing/little to clear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grove Park Road, Mottingham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unbearable bin area, 6th December
item.description:
I am one of the tenant from flat 11. I cleaned the bin area for 3 times already, I live here for 5 years. I am not a property manager or owner. The flat owners don't deal with this problem, the owner of the land and the whole building does not care. The shop that has common wall with the bin area destroyed the fence that separated this view but they have never cleaned the area since they opened the Yoga shop. We look for urgent help and suggestions for long term solution. Otherwise , every 6 months it looks the same.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Bourne Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole in road outside 7 Harland Avenue, 6th December
item.description:
This pothole is over 2 inches deep, and there is loose concrete around the edge (recent surface crumbling). The pothole is deep enough to cause tyre or suspension damage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Harland Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
